Neil is founder and CEO of Valuevineâ„¢, a location-based analytics company, that transforms social media and location-based consumer content into actionable business insight. A product visionary, Neil has been focused on the concept of Valuevineâ„¢ since the Fall of 2008.

In addition to actively volunteering in the community, Neil is a Board Member of the Location Based Marketing Association, and is a 2011 honoree of the Puget Sound Business Journalâ€™s 2011 40 Under 40.

Most recently, Neil was managing director of Acture Ventures, where his firm worked with emerging technology clients, including Verdiem, Whitepages.com, PayScale, RescueTime, RadiantGrid, and Delve Networks (now Limelight Networks). Acture Ventures was acquired by Coppei Partners.

Prior to Acture Ventures, Neil was a founding team member at Ignition Partners backed Jobster (now Recruiting.com) from 2004 to 2007, where he played various leadership roles in the company, including leading the enterprise product management team. Prior to Jobster, Neil spent nearly 5 years as a lead product manager at Microsoft Corporation, where he managed the development of marketing, CRM, and lead generation systems for Microsoft Global Marketing. Neil has also held positions at Accenture, Emerald Solutions, The Carlson Group. Prior to his career in business, Neil served in US Army Intelligence.

Neil is passionate about customers, products, and leveraging technology to help businesses grow. Neil graduated from Pacific Lutheran University, where he studied finance and entrepreneurship. He also holds certificate in Russian studies from the Defense Language Institute.
